name: Best Christmas Cranberry Torte
author: SUE74
summary: This recipe is my all-time favorite dessert! We serve it every year at Christmas and I always devour many helpings! Its frozen cranberry filling is almost like an ice cream cake, and the graham cracker crust is simply luscious.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed
directions: Combine graham cracker crumbs, pecans, sugar, and butter in a mixing bowl for crust
Press into the bottom and up the sides of an 8-inch springform pan
Meanwhile, combine cranberries and sugar for filling in a large mixing bowl
Add egg whites, orange juice, vanilla extract, and salt
Beat using an electric mixer on low speed until frothy
Beat on high until stiff peaks form (when the tips stand straight), 6 to 8 minutes
Whip cream in a small mixing bowl until soft peaks (or until the tips curl over); fold into cranberry mixture
Turn into crust and freeze until firm, 8 hours to overnight
Stir sugar and cornstarch for glaze together in a saucepan
Cook and stir over medium-low heat until bubbly, about 5 minutes
Continue to cook, stirring occasionally, just until cranberry skins pop, about 5 minutes
Let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes; do not chill
Spoon cranberry glaze in the center; place orange slices around the outside
